alert.note: Alert for Crane; Culberson; Jeff Davis; Pecos; Reeves; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 22 at 6:51PM CDT until April 22 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Northeastern Jeff Davis County in southwestern Texas... Ward County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... East central Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Southern Upton County in western Texas... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 651 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles south of Rankin to 9 miles southeast of Mentone, moving southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 175 and 314. Interstate 20 between mile markers 0 and 86. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, Monahans, Crane, McCamey, Kent, Toyah, Balmorhea, Thorntonville, Grandfalls, Barstow, Pyote, Saragosa, Balmorhea Lake, Balmorhea State Park, Wickett, Toyah Lake, Imperial Reservoir, Upton County Airport and Bakersfield. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Crane; Culberson; Jeff Davis; Pecos; Reeves; Upton; Ward
